Learn how to create and process long-run: Learn how to create and process long-running task
The Task package provides comprehensive: The Task package provides comprehensive task management functionality in the MBC CQRS Serverless framework. It enables:
Define step function task event handler: Define step function task event handler
Creates a new task for single task proce: Creates a new task for single task processing.
Creates a new task for Step Functions pr: Creates a new task for Step Functions processing. The input array will be processed as subtasks.
Retrieves a task by its primary key.
Lists tasks by tenant code and type.
List all tasks for a tenant: List all tasks for a tenant
Creates subtasks from a parent task's in: Creates subtasks from a parent task's input array. Each item in the input array becomes a separate subtask.
Typically called within a TaskQueueEvent: Typically called within a TaskQueueEvent handler
Returns array of TaskEntity for each inp: Returns array of TaskEntity for each input item
Retrieves all subtasks for a parent task: Retrieves all subtasks for a parent task.
Returns all subtasks under the parent ta: Returns all subtasks under the parent task
Updates the status of a task and sends a: Updates the status of a task and sends an SNS notification.
Updates the status of a subtask and send: Updates the status of a subtask and sends an SNS notification with action `"sub-task-status"`.
Updates a Step Function task with attrib: Updates a Step Function task with attributes and status, then sends an SNS notification.
Publishes an alarm notification via SNS: Publishes an alarm notification via SNS when an error occurs during task processing. This method is typically called from error handlers in task processing workflows.
Formats the task status by calculating s: Formats the task status by calculating subtask counts and aggregating status information. Useful for displaying task progress in UI.
Get all subtasks for a parent task: Get all subtasks for a parent task
Task has been created but not yet starte: Task has been created but not yet started
